                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       Career and Professional Development at Silver     The Silver School of Social Work is committed to providing exceptional career and professional development opportunities for social work students at all levels.       Events & Workshops   Job Listings & Fellowships   Silver Career & Professional Development Program   Common Day   Licensing Resources   Loan Forgiveness   Mentoring       NYU Wasserman Center for Career Development     The cornerstone of career development at New York University resides in the Wasserman Center for Career Development. The Wasserman Center provides services for students and alumni of NYU. For more information, visit their website .                                                                                                                                                                                                            Social Work Salary Information                                                                                                   We encourage students to research all aspects of employment, including salary ranges. While salary can vary accross fields of practice, type of work, location, and type of employer, here are good places to start to make sure you have the information you need to make sound decisions on job offers.     NASW Compensation & Benefits Study (2010)   Bureau of Labor Statistics   See also: Healthcare Social Workers , Mental Health and Substance Abuse Social Workers , and Community and Social Service Work                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Order Business Cards             for NYU Silver Students                                                                                            Conference Funding       for current students                                                                                                      Job Search Engines                                                                                                     NYU CareerNet Login Page   Above Average Social Work Services (UK)     Allied Health Careers   Idealist.org   iHireSocialServices   National Association of Social Workers   Non-Profit Career Network   NY State - Office of Mental Health   Professionals for NonProfits   Philanthropy Careers   RewardingWork.org   SocialService.com   Social Work Job Bank   Social Work P.R.N. The Wasserman Center is here to help make those first steps as easy as possible. There may be a lot to accomplish - let us help you take it one step at a time.                             Preparing for the Job Search:        Resumes, Cover Letters,          Interviewing & Networking                                         Find a Job or Internship:        NYU CareerNet,          On-Campus Employment & Recruitment                                         Career Fairs:        Make the Most          Out of Career Fairs                                              Eligible NYU Schools     The Wasserman Career Development Center is open to all New York University undergraduate and graduate degree candidates* and alumni from the Center for Urban Science and Progress · College of Arts and Science · College of Nursing · Gallatin School of Individualized Study · Global Public Health Program · Graduate School of Arts and Science · Liberal Studies · Polytechnic School of Engineering · Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service · School of Professional Studies (including Graduate Certificates) · Silver School of Social Work · Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development · Stern School of Business (Undergraduate only) · Tisch School of the Arts.     * Stern School of Business (Graduate) , School of Law , School of Medicine, and College of Dentistry students are eligible for assistance with alternative careers.          School-Specific Career Services Offices   Students from the following schools are encouraged to use the resources at the Wasserman Center and also at their school's career center.   » The Wasserman Center | School of Professional Studies     » Tisch School of the Arts   » Robert F.                          Bread Crumbs          Faculty   /   Teaching and Learning Resources   /   Instructional Technology Support   /   Instructional Technology Tools & Services   /   Learning Portfolio                 Sub Navigation                                 Learning Portfolio Timeline                       Learning Portfolio Overview                       Learning Portfolios in Action                       Learning Portfolio: A Digital Portfolio for Students                                                                   Learning Portfolio Overview                                              The Learning Portfolio is a cloud-based tool that allows students to upload a variety of material reflective of their academic work at NYU, which can then be shared with potential employers or academic advisors, professors, and admissions officers. Students can store and access their academic materials at anytime, from anywhere.   The initiative creates a secure, digital environment to store and archive student work, and allows for easy sharing, reviewing and commenting. It facilitates the organization of saved work across multiple classes, multiple projects, and multiple years of study. This, in turn, allows students, faculty and advisors to compare academic progress over a semester, a year, or an entire academic career.                Faculty   For faculty, Learning Portfolios can provide a more in-depth look at how students are performing by pulling together available learning data into one space that can help faculty when evaluating student-learning behavior and present an overall snapshot of how individual students are performing.                Students   For students, Learning Portfolios offer a chance to store all of their academic work in one online portfolio that stays with them and continues to grow throughout their academic career. It also offers students a chance to put together an academic resume that can be used when transitioning from school to the job market or to an advanced degree program.           Next Steps   Learning Portfolio will be further refined to integrate more functionality and learning insights from various NYU schools and departments. New technology capabilities will be included and further case studies will be added.     Please reference this site for regular updates about Learning Portfolio and how it will eventually be rolled out across NYU. For more information about Learning Portfolio’s potential uses for faculty and students, read the article about a previously conducted pilot program.        Contact us for more information learningportfolio@nyu.edu                                                Learning Portfolio Home                                                                    Related Reading                  Learning Portfolio Timeline Detailed information on the rollout of NYU's Learning Portfolio initiative.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Career and Professional Development at Silver     The Silver School of Social Work is committed to providing exceptional career and professional development opportunities for social work students at all levels.       Events & Workshops   Job Listings & Fellowships   Silver Career & Professional Development Program   Common Day   Licensing Resources   Loan Forgiveness   Mentoring       NYU Wasserman Center for Career Development     The cornerstone of career development at New York University resides in the Wasserman Center for Career Development. The Wasserman Center provides services for students and alumni of NYU. For more information, visit their website .                                                                                                                                                                                                            Social Work Salary Information                                                                                                   We encourage students to research all aspects of employment, including salary ranges. While salary can vary accross fields of practice, type of work, location, and type of employer, here are good places to start to make sure you have the information you need to make sound decisions on job offers. The Wasserman Center is here to help make those first steps as easy as possible. There may be a lot to accomplish - let us help you take it one step at a time.                             Preparing for the Job Search:        Resumes, Cover Letters,          Interviewing & Networking                                         Find a Job or Internship:        NYU CareerNet,          On-Campus Employment & Recruitment                                         Career Fairs:        Make the Most          Out of Career Fairs                                              Eligible NYU Schools     The Wasserman Career Development Center is open to all New York University undergraduate and graduate degree candidates* and alumni from the Center for Urban Science and Progress · College of Arts and Science · College of Nursing · Gallatin School of Individualized Study · Global Public Health Program · Graduate School of Arts and Science · Liberal Studies · Polytechnic School of Engineering · Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service · School of Professional Studies (including Graduate Certificates) · Silver School of Social Work · Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development · Stern School of Business (Undergraduate only) · Tisch School of the Arts.     * Stern School of Business (Graduate) , School of Law , School of Medicine, and College of Dentistry students are eligible for assistance with alternative careers.          School-Specific Career Services Offices   Students from the following schools are encouraged to use the resources at the Wasserman Center and also at their school's career center.   » The Wasserman Center | School of Professional Studies     » Tisch School of the Arts   » Robert F. Portfolio                 Sub Navigation                                 Learning Portfolio Timeline                       Learning Portfolio Overview                       Learning Portfolios in Action                       Learning Portfolio: A Digital Portfolio for Students                                                                   Learning Portfolio Overview                                              The Learning Portfolio is a cloud-based tool that allows students to upload a variety of material reflective of their academic work at NYU, which can then be shared with potential employers or academic advisors, professors, and admissions officers. Students can store and access their academic materials at anytime, from anywhere.   The initiative creates a secure, digital environment to store and archive student work, and allows for easy sharing, reviewing and commenting. It facilitates the organization of saved work across multiple classes, multiple projects, and multiple years of study. This, in turn, allows students, faculty and advisors to compare academic progress over a semester, a year, or an entire academic career.                Faculty   For faculty, Learning Portfolios can provide a more in-depth look at how students are performing by pulling together available learning data into one space that can help faculty when evaluating student-learning behavior and present an overall snapshot of how individual students are performing.                Students   For students, Learning Portfolios offer a chance to store all of their academic work in one online portfolio that stays with them and continues to grow throughout their academic career. It also offers students a chance to put together an academic resume that can be used when transitioning from school to the job market or to an advanced degree program.           Next Steps   Learning Portfolio will be further refined to integrate more functionality and learning insights from various NYU schools and departments. New technology capabilities will be included and further case studies will be added.     Please reference this site for regular updates about Learning Portfolio and how it will eventually be rolled out across NYU. For more information about Learning Portfolio’s potential uses for faculty and students, read the article about a previously conducted pilot program.        Contact us for more information learningportfolio@nyu.edu                                                Learning Portfolio Home                                                                    Related Reading                  Learning Portfolio Timeline Detailed information on the rollout of NYU's Learning Portfolio initiative.
